bioghist.p: Robert Montgomery Bird (1806-1854) was an American writer, photographer, and physician. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania's Medical School and College of Pharmacy in 1827. He wrote several verse plays for the actor Edwin Forrest , most notably "The Gladiator" (1831) and "The Broker of Bogota" (1834). He also wrote fiction, including The Infidel (1835), Sheppard Lee (1836) and Nick of the Woods (1837), and was the editor of American Monthly magazine. He married Mary Mayer in 1837 and they had a son, Frederick, in 1838. He took up photography late in life.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of Bird family correspondence. Materials include: notes from Robert Montgomery Bird to Mary E. Mayer (includes transcriptions); letters to Frederic Mayer Bird from E. L. McClellan, Oliver W. Holmes, Henry W. Longfellow, Charles G. Leland and others; letters from Bird to his mother, Elizabeth Barr; and letters to and from Bird and other family members. There are also some miscellaneous financial records.
